Amateur Radio demonstrations and talks.
Members representing AMSAT-UK (Amateur Satellites), BATC (British Amateur Television Club), UKuG (UK Microwave Group).

properties.name: Furry High Commission

A village for EMF's Furry community. If you're a furry, or interested in the furry fandom, come and say hi. Many of our number are particularly interested in electronics and radio. We're also a very LGBTQ group.

properties.name: London Aerospace
properties.description: The increasingly misnamed London Aerospace. All things drone and model flight-related. We're a friendly bunch, so feel free to swing by and say hello, or simply stare at our mesmerising RGB village sign.

properties.name: Food Hacking Base
properties.description: We are bunch of hackers from all around the world who are into food, drinks and bio, experimenting wildly and enjoying each others presence.

properties.description: We are a hackerspace based in Edinburgh, bringing our members, friends, and their hacks. All welcome!

properties.name: Milliways
properties.description:
Milliways is a group of information security specialists at hacker camps. 

We bring large infrastructure which we plan and built ourselves. The intercontinental logistics include self constructed installations.

properties.description: Just York Hackspace and associated folks camping in a field in Herefordshire.

properties.description: The Hardware Hacking Area is a place available for all participants of EMF Camp -- all day and all night.  There are soldering tools and other tools for creating and fixing, as well as for the many workshops scheduled throughout E...

properties.name: lowland village
properties.description: Group of buddies from the lowlands; the Netherlands and Flanders, with a broad variety of interests. sysadmin, HAM radio, experimental music making and (retro) gaming.

properties.name: Koala Programming
properties.description: A small group formed when two loosely connected communities accidentally realised they'd both have attendees at EMF. Not really anything to do with Koalas, and not everyone is a programmer either. Naming things is hard!
